Articles.Content:
Building or area when we can "store" our rockets and after we have few in there we should be able to compare sizes, putting one next to other (without physics), and of course also compare other parameters like burn time, weight, parts count, payload weight etc etc.

Flight records. We should be able to write flight record and post it on forums, so other people would just load it and watch like video, but in-game.

It should have smaller size comparing to video files and should allow us to rotate camera during watching.

If anyone have been playing in Battle foe Middle Earth (first game) maybe you remember there was option to record and share even multiplayer match and in Kerbal it would be great, since videos are cool, but we can't look all those super projectes from angle we want to.

Edited September 7, 2014 by Darnok

If you're creative enough, you can already make yourself a museum.

(PICTURES INCOMING)

Yes, we can, but can you do this without lag from 1000+ parts?

And museum could also provide UI for watching flights/missions records

(PICTURES INCOMING)

CHOO CHOO! The pictures have arrived, e'rebody. These are from a really old save, but I think they illustrate the concept fairly well. All of the spacecraft played an important role on that save, and they were far enough that they didn't cause any lag when launching rockets. I removed all unimportant things from them (fuel, RTGs, mechjeb, hidden landing gear...), so they wouldn't impact FPS that much, though.

But I can't see any rockets there Sir.

Try put this

and few other rockets like that

I do understand that imagination is important, but still I would like to see any way to compare two or more rockets sizes etc etc

and see flight and mission records using rotate and zoom camera as I want to

But I can't see any rockets there Sir.

Try put this

http://i.imgur.com/LFO8C4Fl.png

and few other rockets like that

I do understand that imagination is important, but still I would like to see any way to compare two or more rockets sizes etc etc

and see flight and mission records using rotate and zoom camera as I want to

Well, that would be a challenge.

Museums have been suggested a lot before, and I'm sure SQUAD will eventually end up adding them to the game. Nice rocket, BTW!

Well, that would be a challenge.

Museums have been suggested a lot before, and I'm sure SQUAD will eventually end up adding them to the game. Nice rocket, BTW!

I hope they will, they can call it even "rocket builder desk" just let me do this

in stock game (+ some stats like name, weight... for each rocket)!!!
